gw.api.policy.refresh

Class PolicyRefreshAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.policy.refresh.PolicyRefreshAlgorithm

  • public class PolicyRefreshAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    The PolicyRefreshAlgorithm keeps the internal state of the PolicyRefreshWizard, and acts as a coordinator for the various steps in the policy refresh as defined by the IPolicyRefreshPlugin.
    Author:
    bspies, tmorris

      • ensureAtStep

        public PolicyRefreshAlgorithm ensureAtStep(PolicyRefreshAlgorithm.RefreshStep step)
        Moves the algorithm forward (or backward) to the appropriate step.
        Parameters:
        step - The target step
        Returns:
        The "this"

      • allowRiskUnitSelection

        public boolean allowRiskUnitSelection()
        Should the user be allowed to select risk units before the policy is fetched? If true then it's not guaranteed that the UI has to give the user that choice, the UI code itself can refine the decision (for example it could decline to allow selection if the policy doesn't actually have any risk units of a particular type). But if this method returns false then the UI should never allow risk unit selection
        Returns:
        true if the UI can choose to allow risk unit selection, false otherwise

      • getPolicySummary

        public PolicySummary getPolicySummary()
        Return the policy summary to use for risk unit selection. This should only be used if allowRiskUnitSelection() is true.
        Returns:
        a non null policy summary in the current bundle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if allowRiskUnitSelection() is false

      • findPolicySummary

        public static PolicySummary findPolicySummary(Policy oldPolicy)
                                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Fetches the policy summary from the policy system associated with the old policy.
        Parameters:
        oldPolicy - The old policy
        Returns:
        the associated policy summary
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If an error occurs retrieving the policy summary

      • doComparison

        public boolean doComparison()
        Retrieves the new policy from the policy system, and performs the comparison. This algorithm step must always be performed first.
        Returns:
        True if the new policy is different than the existing policy

      • getUI

        public PolicyRefreshUI getUI()
        Returns the user interface display for the policy comparison.
        Returns:
        The policy comparison UI

      • getMessages

        public UIMessageList getMessages()
        Returns the UI messages generated by comparing the policies
        Returns:
        A non null message list

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Finishes the algorithm (last step).

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the wizard.
